abstract: Five-minute oscillation modes are advected by horizontal velocities below the solar surface, and thus can be used as probes of rotation and large-scale convective flows. Results of inverse theory applied to observations of high-degree modes carried out on six separate days reveal variations in horizontal velocities with depth from day to day that may be the result of giant convection cells, through noise in the data makes this interpretation somewhat tentative.
title: Attempt to measure the solar subsurface velocity
